task_summary: The robot perceives, approaches, aligns with, and opens a lid in a sequential manner.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robotic manipulator tasked to open a lid. The sequence begins with visual perception of the lid, followed by approach and alignment maneuvers. Once in position, the robot executes an open container action on the lid, likely by lifting or tilting. The scene consists of a white circular lid against a blue background; no other objects are apparent. Safety and precise timing are considered, given the uncluttered environment.
preconditions: Lid is present within the manipulator's reachable workspace.
Lid is initially closed and visible or can be detected.
stepwise_plan: Check if lid is visible; otherwise, detect the lid.
Move the end-effector above the lid.
Approach and align with the lid for grasp/manipulation.
Open the container by actuating the lid.
Wait briefly to ensure state change is stable.
success_criteria: Lid is fully separated from its closed state.
No object damage or excessive force applied.
failure_and_recovery: If the lid is not detected, re-attempt detection.
If opening fails, do not force to prevent damage.
task_long_description.termination: After the lid is opened and a brief wait, the episode completes.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the lid is visually detected.
Runs perception to detect the lid if not already visible.
Moves the end-effector above the lid by an offset.
Approaches and precisely aligns with the lid before grasping or manipulation.
Executes an open operation specific to lid-type containers.
Waits briefly after opening operation for confirmation and stability.

failure_modes: Lid not detectable due to occlusion or perception failure
Gripper slip or unsuccessful open actuation
Timeouts due to excessive operation time
recovery_strategy: Fallback to DetectObject if lid not visible
Abort on multiple failures to prevent damage
assumptions: Instruction says 'open lid', and all frames consistently show a round white lid; no other objects are implied.
No explicit force or grasping method specified, so library default and visual evidence guide parameter values.
Lid geometry suggests vertical displacement; assumed to be opened by lifting, as shown in last frames.

expected_success_criteria: Lid is visibly separated from base by episode end.
